intro: Sida denudata, commonly known as desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is an annual herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are hairy and often covered in fine white pubescence. Its flowers are pink to purple, with five petals and numerous stamens, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Sida denudata is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
